#Text=CanadaVOTES : CHP candidate Jerome
#Text=Dondo running in Brandon — Souris
#Text=Saturday , September 27 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=Christian Heritage Party candidate Jerome Dondo , CGA is standing for election in the riding of Brandon — Souris .
#Text=Self-employed since 2000 , Dondo works as a finance consultant with First Nation reserves , and provides accounting services to small business clients .
#Text=From 1993-1998 , he worked in the accounts department of Transport Canada .
#Text=He volunteered as a pastor for Pentecostal Faith Temple in Cat Lake , Ontario , and is currently on the Parent ’s Advisory Committee of Ecole Gilbert Rosset , St-Claude , Manitoba .
#Text=Wikinews contacted Jerome , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=Merv Tweed is the Conservative Party incumbent in the riding .
#Text=Along with Dondo , challengers include M.J. Willard ( Liberal ) , John Bouché ( NDP ) , Dave Barnes ( Green ) , and Lisa Gallagher ( Communist ) .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=I have decided to run for political office because I think we live in a great country , and I want to do my part to continue building up on the heritage of our ancestors .
#Text=When this country was founded , the preamble of the constitution states " Whereas Canada is founded upon principles that recognize the supremacy of God and the rule of law ... " .
#Text=At the federal level , we have seen many examples where this fact is not upheld .
#Text=The Christian Heritage party is the only federal party which supports the whole constitution as written , and will base it laws upon the principles set out in the Bible .
#Text=I am running in this riding because the riding that I live in already had a candidate in this riding , and Brandon-Souris is the closest to where I live .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=This is my first political experience .
#Text=However , in my work as a First Nation consultant , I have had much experience dealing with political issues , both at the federal and provincial level .
#Text=I am also volunteering as a member of the parent ’s advisory committee in our children ’s school , and have volunteered in the past as a lay pastor of a church .

#Text=The experiences have taught me how to listen to people ’s concerns and explain any positions that I have taken in decisions , while at the same time hearing their concerns and taking those concerns to the appropriate people .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=The Brandon-Souris riding is a large riding with diverse interests and concerns .
#Text=This riding includes people living in a city , family farms , and First Nations .
#Text=Therefore it is difficult to identify major issues .
#Text=That said , It appears that the three hottest topics that I have encountered so far in no particular order are :
#Text=The farmer ’s concerns about the Canadian Wheat Board .
#Text=The family concerns about the lack of support for family with only one income .
#Text=The First Nation concerns are the settling of land claims .
#Text=In each of these and other issues , the Christian Heritage Party have a platform which can be viewed on the party website at www . chp . ca .

#Text=In terms of the issues listed above , our party supports the dismantling of the Canadian Wheat Board , offering a $ 1,000 monthly child-care support for families in which one parent stays at home with the children , and we believe that First Nation land claims should be settled quickly .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=Being a small federal party , I have found that there is a lack of knowledge of our party more than a misconception .
#Text=We do not have access to the same dollars that the five larger parties and given from our tax dollars based on the number of votes in the last election .
#Text=This money can be used by the larger parties for advertising which we cannot afford and makes it more difficult to get our message out .
#Text=There 's a more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=Since this is my first campaign , I have not comment on this at this time .
